Swift: UIView Animation

Sunday, March 29, 2015

Overview

Animations and transitions are extremely important in iOS development. That’s why you have to know them (I feel like I say that a lot…)! You can find more information about animations here.

Content

animateWithDuration

This function only works with the alpha, frame and transform props of a UIView. You can use this to fade in, rotate the view or the size.

 1 class UIView {
 2     class func animateWithDuration(duration: NSTimeInterval,
 3                                       delay: NSTimeInterval,
 4                                     options: UIViewAnimationOptions,
 5                                  animations: () -> Void,
 6                                  completion: ((finished: Bool) -> Void)? )
 7 }
 8 
 9 if myView.alpha = 1.0 {
10     UIView.animateWithDuration(3.0,
11                         delay: 2.0,
12                       options: UIViewAnimationOptions.CurveEaseInEaseOut,
13                    animations: { myView.alpha = 0.0 },
14                    completion: { if $0 { myView.removeFromSuperview()}} )
15 }
16 /*
17 Fade myView out over 3 seconds starting 2 seconds from now.
18 When done, remove myView from view hierarchy if the fade completed.
19  */
 1 /*
 2 UIViewAnimationOptions
 3 
 4   BeginFromCurrentState       // interrupt other, in-progress animations of these props
 5   AllowUserInteraction        // allow gestures to get processed while animation is in progress
 6   LayoutSubviews              // animate the relayout of subviews with parent's animation
 7   Repeat                      // repeat indefinitely
 8   Autoreverse                 // play animation forward then back
 9   OverrideInheritedDuration   // if not set, use duration of any in-progress animation
10   OverrideInheritedCurve      // if not set, use curve of in-progress animation
11   Allow AnimatedContent       // if not set, just interpolate between current and end
12   CurveEaseInEaseOut          // slower at first, normal middle, slow end
13   CurveEaseIn                 // slow at first, constant else
14   CurveLinear                 // same speed
15  */

transitionWithView

This one allows you to make an entire view modification at once.

 1 class UIView {
 2     class func transitionWithView(view: UIView,
 3                               duration: NSTimeInterval,
 4                                options: UIViewAnimationOptions,
 5                             animations: () -> Void,
 6                             completion: ((finished: Bool) -> Void)? )
 7 }
 8 
 9 UIView.transitionWithView(view: myPlayingCardView,
10                       duration: 0.75,
11                        options: UIViewAnimationOptions.TransitionFlipFromLeft,
12                     animations: { cardIsFaceUp = !cardIsFaceUp},
13                     completion: nil )
14 /*
15 myPlayingCardView draws itself face up or down depending on `cardIsFaceUp`.
16 This will cause the card to flip over.
17  */
